boardgame.name: Fire in the Sky
Fire in the Sky: The Great Pacific War 1941-1945
Rise and Fall of Imperial Japan
boardgame.description: International Game Series game from Multi-Man Publishing._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Simulating the Pacific Front of World War II has always been one of the great wargame design challenges. The same distance that planes could cover in a few hours took days for ships and weeks for foot soldiers. Hostile jungles and great oceans combined to make logistics and transport of paramount historical concerns. These and other design puzzles are solvable by only the most gifted designers._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Renowned Japanese wargame designer Tetsuya Nakamura has successfully met these challenges and Multi-Man Publishing is to offer the elegant result - Fire in the Sky. Fire in the Sky has, until now, only been available in Japanese._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;With only one map and 180 counters, Fire in the Sky packs years of prior Pacific design attempts and experience into an effort that beautifully distills the essence of the conflict and serves as further proof that great things do indeed come in small packages. Fire in the Sky provides players with the same problems and perspectives faced by the historical combatants, yet does so in a game that can be played in 5 hours or less. The game is ingeniously balanced and so provides not only a look into the minds of the actual commanders, but also a fun, competitive and tense gaming experience._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game includes glorious 1-inch counters, a clever map that integrates hexes and areas, and rules that cover all of the essential aspects of the Great Pacific War. Oil convoys and troop transports are as vital to victory as the massive Carrier fleets that steam over the vast Pacific. Tetsuya Nakamura_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rsquo;s intelligent and ingenious design also offers Western players a fascinating glimpse into the Japanese perspective on the war._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2005 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Nominee

Out of shrink wrap, but never played or punched My late husband was an avid board game collector. It is time for the games to find new homes, hopefully to someone who enjoys them as much as he did. Punched and played twice, but in great condition and all pieces accounted for. Because the map is laminated (I laminate all maps after a notorious flooding problem two decades ago) and requires a tube to ship in, the game will come in two packages. I can_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t edit the settings, but I will cover the shipping, so the $100 includes everything, as long as it is to the lower 48 states (sorry Alaska and Hawaii!).

Counters have a protective layer on them. Map has been laminated. Basically, this game should be able weather tons and tons of plays. Rules are intact, no highlighting, no yellowing or other kinds of notes. Counter tray is included in the box. Please note that with a laminated map which I would have to ship that component in a tube. However both the game box and map would be shipped together to cut costs. I estimate $28 USD for continental US addresses, but that was based on mostly US north east codes postal codes, not sure how much of difference it would make if sent elsewhere in the US. Canada will likely be cheaper (I will still quote in USD though). Outside of North America shipping costs may well match or exceed the sale price, though I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m willing to consider a $10 discount in such a scenario (I would update the price upon agreeing to a sale).

Condition - Punched but unplayed. Box has very light shelf wear but could easily pass as off the store shelf new stock. Counters are unplayed, unworn, and in excellent condition. Rule book, map, and all other original content in like new condition. Payment by PayPal in advance or cash on pickup. For shipping this is considered a medium size game. The following options are available for delivery within the continental United States: 1) Local pickup in the San Jose, California area (no cost) 2) USPS Priority Mail Flat Rate - $6.60 (small), $12.65 (medium), or $17.15 (large), depending on game size. Generally very small games fit in the small box, small or medium in the medium box, and large in the large box. Box fits for some games are very snug, allowing minimal protective padding - if this shipping option is picked for such games seller assumes no responsibility for damage during transit. 3) USPS Parcel Select Ground / Non-Flat Rate Priority - varies, usually only cheaper than Flat Rate Priority for small and very light weight games (under 2 pounds), an additional fee of $3.25 for the box and packing materials will be added to the shipping costs. 4) FedEx Ground - varies, usually from $12 for short distance shipments of light weight games to $30 for heavy games (or multiple games up to 10 pounds) long distance shipments. This is usually the cheapest option for very large games. An additional fee of $3.25 for the box and packing materials will be added to the shipping costs. While expensive, this is the best method if damage during transit is a concern, as all items will be packed in boxes sufficiently sized for protective materials. Shipping rates to Alaska or Hawaii will be higher for FedEx. Games will not be shipped by any method other than a shipping box, nor unboxed or in less than complete condition, please do not ask.
